commitResults.messageBody:
This project is awful. I can't do anything about it short of deleting it
and rewriting it from the ground up. So I'm just going to revert it to
the way it was and we'll have to deal with it.

I know this git commit does not follow the git convention. I don't care.
I hate it.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add remarks to person

Remove unecessary field parsers
commitResults.messageBody:
There are parsers for every field in Person, which comprehensive tests
for each of the parser. However, these parsers are are duplicates of the
same functionality as the constructors of the fields themselves, with
the only exception being a String.trim() call.

Removing these duplicated code improves the code quality and vastly
reduces the number of tests necessary.

As a step towards better code quality, let's remove all of these
duplicated, useless, worthless, trash, shit code. Doing so will improve
our efficiency, decrease our workload, and improve our sanity.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix checkstyle issues
[Resolves #40] Remove unecessary field parsers (#42)
commitResults.messageBody:
* Remove unecessary field parsers

There are parsers for every field in Person, which comprehensive tests
for each of the parser. However, these parsers are are duplicates of the
same functionality as the constructors of the fields themselves, with
the only exception being a String.trim() call.

Removing these duplicated code improves the code quality and vastly
reduces the number of tests necessary.

As a step towards better code quality, let's remove all of these
duplicated, useless, worthless, trash, shit code. Doing so will improve
our efficiency, decrease our workload, and improve our sanity.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update Readme to have Codecov badge
Update README.md
Update edit command to use updated person's fields
commitResults.messageBody:
When new fields are added into person class, they also need to be manually added and updated to editCommand and editCommandParser.

Update with changes made from PR #16. Allows the fields to be modified and updated in one place without having to update edit command and edit command parser.

The decoupling will help make things smoother in the future and the process more efficient. Chances of bugs are also reduced since everything will be in a single place. Reduces the need to make multiple changes when new fields are added.

commitResults.messageTitle: Check if person's primary key is violated in edit command
commitResults.messageBody:
User can input multiple people with the same emails or other fields that are suppose to be unique with the same values.

Make editCommand check whether when a user edits a field value, there is already an existing value.

Helps prevent duplicate or 'fake' persons from populating the addressBook.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix checkstyle issue for AddressBook
Fix issues with testcases related to EditPersonDescriptor
Modify same field violation in addressBook to use isSamePerson instead
commitResults.messageBody:
There's redundant codes for checking whether the person's edit data is already in the addressBook.

Modify to use the function isSamePerson instead and isSamePerson would now check the fields that should not be duplicated in the addressBook instead of just checking the name since people can have the same name.
